back: replaced elemets are those where the element's content that is replaced by something that is not directly represented in the document content img and input elements are replaced elements example:
nonreplaced elements are the majority of HTML elements. There content is presented by the user agent inside a box genreated by the element itself example: nonreplaced

block-level elements - generate an element box that fills its parent element's content area and cannot have other elements at its sides inline-level elements - generate an element box within a line of text and do not break up the fow of that line

block-level cannot be contained in inline-level elements in HTML - violation. CSS can change add this behavior:

example

p {display: inline;} em {display: block}
